paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the KCNH2 (1956, C>T) polymorphism and its association with antihypertensive drug response in patients with essential hypertension.

patients.demographics: age and gender diverse, specific demographics not detailed

functional_data.summary: The KCNH2 (1956, C>T) polymorphism is associated with the efficacy of antihypertensive drugs, particularly calcium channel blockers and α,β-ADR blockers.

variants.population_frequency: T allele frequency was 10.1%, C allele frequency was 89.9%
variants.additional_notes: The study indicates that the KCNH2 (1956, C>T) polymorphism may serve as a novel biomarker for individualized therapy.
key_quotes: We have reported for the first time that KCNH2 (1956, C>T) polymorphism is associated with efficacy of antihypertensive drugs CCBs and ADR blockers.
The descent of blood pressure after azelnidipine or nitrendipine administration was significantly between KCNH2 (1956,C>T) CC genotype and CT/TT genotype groups.

tables_processed.table_caption: Baseline characteristics of patients among gender, age, and KCNH2 (1956,C>T) genotypes groups.
Genotype distributions and allele frequencies of KCNH2 (1956, C>T) polymorphism.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the KCNH2 gene and provided clear data.
